html.p: Consider two points A and B in the electric field produced by a small particle located at [mathjaxinline]\vec{r}_{\rm s}= 0\; \hat{\imath }+3\; \hat{\jmath } + 0 \; \hat{k}[/mathjaxinline] and carrying a charge [mathjaxinline]q_{\rm s} = 1\; \mu[/mathjaxinline]C. The two field points are at [mathjaxinline]\vec{r}_{\rm A}= 0\; \hat{\imath }+16\; \hat{\jmath } + -5 \; \hat{k}[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]\vec{r}_{\rm B}= 3\; \hat{\imath }+7\; \hat{\jmath } + 0 \; \hat{k}[/mathjaxinline]. The coordinate values are all in meters.
